title: Table 2.D.3.1 — Data Required for Determination of the DF — CUI

rows.comment: The drivers for external CUI corrosion. See 2.D.2.6.2 for driver descriptions and selection.
Corrosion rate for external CUI corrosion. Based on temperature, and driver (see below), or user input.
The date the coating was installed.
Relates to the type of coating applied under the insulation, for example: None—no coating or primer only; Medium—single coat epoxy; High—multi-coat epoxy or filled epoxy.
If the equipment has a design or fabrication detail that allows water to pool and increase metal loss rates...
The number of protrusions such as branch connections, nozzles, pipe supports... defined as Below Average, Average, Above Average.

rows.data: Insulation condition? (Above Average, Average, or Below Average)
rows.comment: Determine the insulation condition based on external visual inspection of jacketing condition...
If piping is supported directly on beams or other such configuration that does not allow for proper coating maintenance...
If the piping has an interface where it enters either soil or water, this area is subject to increased corrosion.
The effectiveness category that has been performed on the component.
The number of inspections in each effectiveness category that have been performed.
The thickness used for the DF calculation is either the furnished thickness or the measured thickness.
The date at which the thickness measurement used in the calculation was obtained.
